results.title: Delhi
results.creator_credit: Ezra Mir and Films Division, Government of India
results.brief_description: Delhi, yesterday and today. Seven times capital of India, it combines the architectural splendour of Mogul and earlier times with a modern garden city. The hotels; the new diplomatic enclave; the mosques and palaces of Shah Jehan; a pre-Mogul fort; holidaying in Delhi today.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ezra Mir and Films Division, Government of India

results.title: Delegation
results.brief_description: Aims to provide all levels of management with skills and knowledge to be able to effectively delegate. The program looks at the definition and benefits of delegation, barriers to effective delegation, ascertaining which tasks can and cannot be delegated, setting goals and choosing the best person for the job. A manual accompanies the video and may be borrowed as a separate loan item.

Episode of Series “Plant Supervisors Problems”.

results.title: Delegating
results.brief_description: Examines the concept of delegating by means of scenarios, making viewers aware of some of the hidden traps in delegation, as well as providing basic steps for managers and teachers that can ease the workload.

results.title: Delegates
results.creator_credit: Derek Hart and Derek Hart Productions
results.brief_description: Shows Red Cross delegates in action in Lebanon. The role of the delegates is clearly portrayed as they visit families to discover their needs and distribute aid, act as mediators in tricky and often dangerous situations and to generally bring about peace and reduce human suffering

results.title: Delayed parenthood: pros and cons
results.brief_description: Looks at the increasing number of women who are having children later in life because of career pressure. Risks such as birth defects are examined and women who have had children later in life are interviewed.

results.title: Degenerate art: the avant-garde in Nazi Germany
results.creator_credit: David Grubin and LA County Museum of Art
results.brief_description: A thorough documentary on Hitler’s Germany from the point of view of the German art world that explores the impact of war and the Nazi regime on artists and the nature of art in Germany. The program is centred around a study of the artists and the works condemned in Hitler’s “Degenerate Art” exhibition following his rise to power after the Great Depression. This badly presented, propaganda style exhibition took 650 abstract and expressionist works from museums and private collections around Germany and toured Germany and Austria for four years as an example of the abstraction and inner awareness that was unacceptable to Hitler’s vision for the new conformist Germany. It was held up as a contrast to Hitler’s self curated exhibits of his vision for new German art at the House of German art opened in 1937. The documentary contains interviews with artists’ families, art critics, historians, and art students, curators and journalists of the time and a detailed analysis of the lives of the condemned artists and innovative art movements such as the Expressionist and Bauhaus school that they represented. These elements, combined with a broad based study of Hitler’s rise to power, and the social, cultural and political impact of the Nazi leadership on Germany, provides a striking perspective on the mass persuasion techniques, suppression, targeting of, and aggression towards, alternative views or unrecognised groups during Hitler’s dictatorship. It also considers the consequences of this history for the future of German art.
results.title_for_label: Degenerate art: the avant-garde in Nazi Germany

results.title: Degas
results.creator_credit: Universal Education and Visual Arts and Skira-Flag Films
results.brief_description: Degas was unique in his ability to synthesize the skill of the classic draftsman with the innovative techniques of the impressionist. His chief interest was the female figure and he never tired of painting the curve of an arm or the extension of a leg. What mattered to him was the light and shade on the human figure. Art students can learn much from his drawings, space arrangements and brilliant coloring.

results.title: Deflection output circuits
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic Television”.
An explanation of vertical and horizontal output circuits for magnetic deflection, staring with the vertical output stages as a typical deflections amplifier. The first part pf the film shows how the sawtooth scanning current in the deflection coils corresponds to linear scanning of the electron beam; it explains oscillations and damping in the output circuit. The remainder of the film builds up the complete horizontal out-put circuit, step by step.
